result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven B Wright was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Must make minimum monthly payments of $50.00 toward restitution.

If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Must participate in a restorative justice program/conference that may include the victim(s).
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
Must submit DNA sample and pay the surcharge.
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment.

Two prison packets to jail.

Defendant Steven B Wright in court with attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond.  John A Rafa Todd appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Covers 15CF463, 16CF476, 18CF79, and 18CF150.
State recites agreement and that victim rights have been complied with.  Attorney Raymond relates waiver of PSI in 18CF150.  Court questions Defendant on waiver of PSI and waiver of Preliminary Hearing.  The Court finds waivers of PSI and Preliminary hearing are knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given.  Court finds probable cause and binds over for trial.  State files an Information in court.  Attorney Raymond waives formal reading and will be entering a guilty plea today.    Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights presented and discussed.

18CF150 - Guilty plea entered.  The Court finds plea is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given.  State relates.  Attorney Raymond relates.  Defendant relates.

Court relates and orders:

15CF463 (Revocation)
COUNT 1
4 years, 6 months Prison
2 years, 6 months initial confinement
2 years, 0 months extended supervision
Dodge Correctional is reception facility.
284 days jail credit.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Costs to continue to be collected through DOC.
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.

COUNT 2
4 years, 6 months Prison - Concurrent to Count 1
2 years, 6 months initial confinement
2 years, 0 months extended supervision
Dodge Correctional is reception facility.
284 days jail credit.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Costs to continue to be collected through DOC.
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.

16CF476 (Revocation)
1 year jail - Concurrent to all other sentences
78 days jail credit.
All unpaid financial obligations are reduced to civil judgment.

18CF79 - DRI

18CF150
4 years 6 months Prison - Concurrent with 15CF463
2 years, 6 months initial confinement.
2 years, 0 months extended supervision
Dodge Correctional is reception facility.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
78 days jail credit.
Costs including DNA sample and surcharge.
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.

Order for DNA given to the defendant in court. Must report to the Barron County Jail immediately to submit DNA sample.
Felony admonitions given and WEDS form given to Defendant in court.
